newsitem.title: USA: Clinton to seek trade authority in September.
newsitem.headline: Clinton to seek trade authority in September.

text.p: President Clinton will submit legislation to Congress in September seeking so-called fast track authority to negotiate international trade agreements, the White House announced Friday.
"The president has come to the conclusion that we should push hard for fast track authority beginning in the Fall, in September," White House Press Secretary Mike McCurry announced.

White House officials had hoped to submit legislation for fast track authority in June but were forced to back away from that timetable after congressional Democrats and Republicans became bogged down in a dispute over whether environmental and labor issues should be part of the agreement.
Under fast track, Congress gives up its right to amend trade agreements and only would be able to vote for or against the entire treaty.
